Definition.WordDefinition: Straightforward \Straight`for"ward\, a. Proceeding in a straight course or manner; not deviating; honest; frank. -- adv. In a straightforward manner. -- {Straight`for"ward*ly}, adv. -- {Straight`for"ward*ness}, n. [1913 Webster]

straightforward adj 1: free from ambiguity; "a straightforward set of instructions" 2: without evasion or compromise; "a square contradiction"; "he is not being as straightforward as it appears" [syn: {square(a)}] 3: without concealment or deception; honest; "their business was open and aboveboard"; "straightforward in all his business affairs" [syn: {aboveboard}] 4: pointed directly ahead; "a straightforward gaze"
